name: St. Noël Chabanel

locations.description: Jesuit missionary, one of the North American Martyrs in Canada

summary: Noël Chabanel was a French Jesuit priest and martyr who worked as a missionary among the Huron people in New France (Canada). He struggled with learning the Huron language and found the mission work difficult, but made a vow to remain in Canada. When the Iroquois attacked the Huron mission, he was killed. He is one of the North American Martyrs and is remembered for his perseverance despite personal difficulties and his faithfulness to his vow.
